intro: Racosperma lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring slender, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers arranged in spikes. It is adapted to dry environments and is often found in sandy soils across the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
